items.content:
Director Of Operations

Posted Mar 15

DataQuest
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://dataquest.breezy.hr/p/220ec187ae46-director-of-operations?source=weworremotely
View all DataQuest jobs →

At Dataquest, we teach data science to a community of hundreds of thousands of students worldwide. We help students deeply learn concepts, build projects, work together, and gain the confidence they need to start new careers. Read more about our philosophy here, and read what students think here.

We're a profitable and self-funded company of 13 with a laser focus on our students. Many of us are either self-taught, or were Dataquest students ourselves, and it's extremely important to us to constantly add value to our students. Our long-term goal is to build a project-based learning platform that is personalized to students and motivates them in ways that existing learning options can't.

We've been growing revenue 2-3x a year since we launched in 2015. As we've scaled, we've noticed operational challenges, that range from the administrative overhead of running a business, to making sure that team members have common goals and accountability.

We're looking for a director of operations who can help us become more efficient. How this role looks exactly will depend on your skills and interests—you'll have a lot of autonomy to help shape a growing education company. Ideally, you’ll have experience scaling early-stage companies.

We think that someone who is a good fit for this role will be:

  • Able to maintain focus while doing many small tasks
  • Extremely good at prioritization
  • Good at setting goals and creating accountability in others
  • Excited to celebrate small wins
  • Good at communicating why people are doing what they're doing and building context
  • Able to cut through to why we're building something, and remove extra effort until just the core effort of an initiative remains
  • Good at giving people the right framework to make quick and efficient decisions
  • Willing to put in the time to understand our students deeply
  • Good at mentoring team members through operational challenges

Potential functional responsibilities for our director of operations role include:

  • Creating and executing a process for sourcing and interviewing candidates
  • Onboarding new team members
  • Helping to document internal processes in a central location
  • Coordinating teams to ensure that everyone has the resources they need
  • Continuously identifying processes that could be improved and testing improvements
  • Helping teams set and stick to goals
  • Making sure the long term and short term roadmaps align with our goals
  • Making sure everyone has the correct context for why they're doing something, and the right framework to make decisions based on that context
  • Managing some of the administrative aspects of the business, such as payroll and legal
  • Communicating the current state of all areas of the company and any blockers to team members

There's a lot of autonomy in our roles, and our goal is to help give all of our team members the correct context and resources to make the right decisions for our students. An ideal director of operations will be able to make everyone on our team more efficient.

Working at Dataquest gives you the chance to work with a mission-focused, motivated team on an important problem.

At Dataquest, you'll get:
  • The opportunity to see your impact on the lives of our students every day
  • The chance to work with an engaged and mission-driven team
  • The chance to define internal process and help a company scale from an early stage
  • The chance to contribute to product direction and decisions
  • The ability to work remotely
  • A supportive and collaborative environment

This is a full-time remote role, and the salary range is $75k - $110k USD per year.

TaxJar Plus Program Manager

Posted Mar 14

TaxJar
Headquarters: 100% remote
www.taxjar.com

TaxJar is building a mid-market/enterprise version of our offering that we call TaxJar Plus. It's the same, great solution we provide to more than 10,000 customers but with additional features and white-glove support that larger merchants need.

We are looking for a Program Manager who will live and breathe TaxJar Plus, working across all functions of the organization to ensure we stay aligned and on track with Plus priorities, and working closely with our Plus customers to ensure they have a great experience from TaxJar onboarding through sales tax filing.The right candidate will be someone with great entrepreneurial spirit, cross functional organization and communication skills, a "utility" player who can work well across marketing, development, sales and customer success.

This will be our first, dedicated TaxJar Plus hire and will initially report to our Chief Revenue Officer (CRO). This is a full-time remote position.

ABOUT THE ROLE
  • Work closely with our initial TaxJar Plus customers to ensure they have a great onboarding experience, and share customer feedback with the marketing and development team
  • Partner with our Customer Success team to build & adjust our processes and tools to provide the white glove priority support our TaxJar Plus customers expect, and help build the strategy on how we provide that top level service as we scale
  • Drive alignment with sales and marketing to understand details of the TaxJar Plus opportunities we win and lose, and use that information to inform the marketing and development teams on how we can improve our messaging & offering
  • Drive alignment across sales, marketing, development, and customer success as we roll out new features of TaxJar Plus, ensuring smooth feature launches & communication
  • Help to operationalize our sales processes for TaxJar Plus, from building processes to sign deals to manage pipeline and onboarding
  • Build dashboards to report on the overall growth and success of the TaxJar Plus business, reporting to the company and leadership team on key findings

ABOUT YOU 
  • You have passion in working directly with customers and will spend time to ensure they are delighted, understanding their wants and needs
  • You have a proven track record of working across functions to streamline communication and drive cross functional projects.
  • Being organized is one of your top strengths, you love managing cross functional alignment
  • You must be a self-starter with lots of initiative and creativity. Prior entrepreneurial experience is a plus.
  • Technology is your ally. You’re comfortable using collaborative tools like BaseCamp, Trello, Google Docs and Zoom. And you’re not afraid to try new tools whenever necessary.
  • You can’t imagine working any way other than remotely.
  • You value working with talented, friendly people who push you to be your best.

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

If you're not the perfect fit for this position, but you know someone who is, we'll pay you $1,000 if you refer us to the person we hire.

BENEFITS

We offer all of our employees amazing benefits. Visit www.TaxJar.com/jobs for a full list of our benefits and to learn more about how we work and what we stand for.

Director of Talent

Posted Feb 27

Hotjar
Headquarters: Malta
https://careers.hotjar.com/o/director-of-talent/?source=WeWorkRemotely
View all Hotjar jobs →

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in time zones that align with Europe (UTC 0 to UTC +2, essentially between Ireland and Eastern Europe). 

Hotjar’s culture is the key to ensuring we are working together optimally to achieve our vision. This position will have the critical objective of ensuring culture is top of mind in everything we do for our team and for those that join our team in the future. Here’s a brief description of what we mean by culture. 

Hotjar's a fast-growing company with a diverse and remotely distributed team of 60+ individuals. We’re looking for someone with the experience, know-how, and mindset to help us achieve our vision by attracting and retaining a premium virtual team. In this role, culture must always be top of mind across everything we currently have in place, change, and/or introduce. 

The Director of Talent will have the responsibility for all people-based strategic and operational activities within Hotjar. They will regularly lead/oversee activities across a variety of areas, such as resource planning, recruitment, training and benefits/perks administration, and will be the first point of contact for internal team member issues handled outside of standard reporting relationships.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Ensure Hotjar’s people-based plans support the needs of the business, but are also flexible enough to align with our culture and cope with changes in the organization
  • Be the primary point of contact for HR related matters
  • Direct the development of norms around our cultural values and continuously execute on ways to reinforce them
  • Manage the recruitment strategy, process and team members for the company
  • Leveraging internal and external resources, create, maintain, and execute on processes and initiatives to actively identify and create demand for candidates that are ideal for open roles and cultivate mutual interest where there’s a fit
  • Ensure the recruitment process aligns with our values, measures emotional intelligence, and includes the right criteria to vet candidates. Iteratively review and improve it.
  • Guide leadership and team member actions by researching, developing, writing, and updating policies, procedures, methods, and guidelines for people related matters
  • Conduct a needs analyses for training, and develop a plan to fulfill the needs of the organization; manage the plan and its associated budget
  • Develop and improve an appraisal and performance based feedback system based on our values
  • Manage performance or grievance issues in a legally compliant, professional and business-minded way
  • Maintain and analyze information on data, such as team turnover, cost per recruitment hire, training hours per person, etc.
  • Develop, execute and maintain a compensation strategy that incorporates factors such as experience, skills, role commonality and diverse geographies
  • Propose and maintain a succession plan for all departments
  • Support the leadership team and team leads by providing personnel centered/human resources advice, counsel, mentoring and decision-making expertise
  • Develop, maintain, and run internal training programs on how to be a good team lead / leader in general and how to collaborate effectively as a remote team.
 

Compensation Range

The budgeted compensation range for this role is €80,000 to €110,000 annually. Ranges are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Hotjar. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills. At this time we are only able to provide official employment status to those located in Malta. All other candidates will join our team as full-time consultants and will be responsible for paying any taxes or applicable fees where they reside.

Requirements

  • At least 5 years of prior experience leading a Human Resource department (or equivalent) for a fast-growing company. This should include companies that have scaled beyond 100+ people.
  • Prior experience with defining and embracing a team culture within the workplace
  • Must be able to demonstrate prior experience putting HR/People Management processes, procedures, and tools in place and evolving, enhancing, and modifying them over time
  • Required to be both strategic in your work and a hands-on working leader. We’re a startup and everyone gets their hands dirty
  • Experience with developing, maintaining and executing on an ambitious recruitment plan
  • Prior experience with delivering training and public speaking
  • Ability to understand areas of potential concern pertaining to labor laws and situations
  • Must be highly organized. You’ll be dealing with a wide variety of issues on any given day. They’ll range from seemingly trivial to mission critical and must continuously be prioritized and acted upon appropriately
  • Fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • The ideal candidate would experience within a remote based company or team

About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Manager
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Financial Technology

Job description

A Software Manager at Confluence is responsible for leading a team of 8 to 12 Software Developers in the production of high-quality Cloud software products.  This position is responsible for the technology, staffing, development, delivery, and ongoing continuous improvement of the software engineering team.  The Software Manager takes a “hands-on” approach by participating in design decisions, code reviews, planning sessions and other technical discussions.   As part of a larger software product development organization, the Software Manager is involved in many cross-functional product and process improvement initiatives as both a team member and leader.  The Software Manager must work full-time from our Pittsburgh, PA office. 

What Will You Do?

  • Recruit, hire, train, mentor, and facilitate the success of a team of talented Software Engineers.
  • Create Employee Development Plans that support, encourage and evaluate personal growth.
  • Maintain team morale via regular individual and team-wide communications. 
  • Perform all HR management activities for your team.  
  • Set team goals and objectives that are aligned with technology, product and business plans.
  • Define, implement and improve software development processes and tools.
  • Support the team in project and product release planning processes.  
  • Lead the team to meeting their commitments by removing roadblocks and providing hands-on assistance. 
  • Stay current with technology trends and instill a continuous learning mindset in the team.
  • Ensure the team is adhering to established quality practices and is proactively identifying quality concerns.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to develop strategies to improve technology and enhance the product portfolio.
  • Occasionally design, develop and test software to maintain a good working knowledge of software development practices, technologies, tools and challenges. 

What Technical Skills Do You Need?
You should have eight or more years of experience in software development with two or more years managing and leading software teams.  

You need these technical skills:

  • Broad experience using Frontend technologies such as JavaScript, Typescript, html, css along with frameworks such as Angular, Aurelia, Bootstrap, Knockout and jQuery.  
  • Experience with backend technologies like C#, ASP.Net, SQL Server, and MongoDB.  Expertise in some subset of these technologies is highly desired.
  • Proven experience delivering commercial Cloud software products. 
  • Significant experience implementing and optimizing the tools and processes used throughout the Software Development Lifecycle.  DevOps or Continuous Integration & Deploy practices are highly desired.   
  • Thorough understanding of software quality practices including unit testing, secure software development practices, and non-functional testing. 
  • Work in an Agile software environment using Scrum.
    You need these management and leadership skills:
  • Expertise at creating high-performing teams focused on team success over individual recognition.
  • Effective at all types of HR People management activities.
  • Proven success developing, mentoring and coaching software engineers of various experience levels.  
  • Takes initiative in planning tasks, removing obstacle, and closing knowledge gaps.
  • Quality mindset.
  • Ability to collaborate cross-functionally.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.

We require a sound decision maker that utilizes knowledge of business to drive decisions with a great sense of commitment in doing the job right the first time. We are looking for someone with a strong willingness to learn continuously and take ownership and accountability.

Experience managing and leading geographically dispersed teams is required as several Confluence Software Developers work remotely full time from their home office.

Confluence's company culture and values guide our decisions, whether it's about product, brand or people. So, if you are an ambassador of Integrity, Imagination, Discipline and Service to others and have the skills and interest, we would love to hear from you.

items.content:
Outbound Telesales Executive
Onify Ltd -Remote
£18,000 - £25,000 a year - Full-time, Permanent

Fancy yourself as a telesales Rockstar? Do you want to be part of the core team in a new startup with huge ambitions? If you answered yes, read on. We have something very exciting to tell you about.

ONIFY is a fast growing startup built around loyalty, customer retention and rewards. Ever wondered why you keep all those loyalty cards? Now you don’t have to. ONIFY rewards your loyalty without you having to carry, collect and locate all those annoying paper cards. Now, you can keep them all on one simple-to-use app and access them at any time.

For businesses, this gives them a complete marketing and customer retention system, with no technology required in-store. No longer are these tools just available to the big players, we are putting them in that hands of everybody so businesses can focus on what they do best. We help them get their customers back through the door time and time again. We believe that we everyone should be rewarded for being loyal to local, independent businesses and ONIFY provides the tools to do just that.

We love our product, and businesses and customers love it as well. We now need to get it in the hand in as many businesses as possible and need somebody to contact potential customers and guide them through the FREE sign up process. This role will be a mix of cold calling, building and maintaining a sales pipeline.

Our team have built marketplaces from scratch before, and we are doing it again with ONIFY. In a brand new role for us, you will be working under the direction of the CEO (founder of fillmybelly.com and Ex Just Eat director), whilst gaining a valuable insight into what it takes to build a company from the ground up, as well as understanding how everything we do affects the growth of the company.

Key skills required:

  • Experience within a sales or telesales environment is a must
  • Self-motivation and ability to work remotely
  • Must be energetic and love what you do
  • A pleasant and confident telephone manner, able to speak to people at various levels of business
  • Able to demonstrate first-class, effective business to business communication
  • Able to handle rejection with the desire to hit targets
  • You will have good literacy and numeracy skills
  • Good IT skills and knowledge of CRM.
  • Monitor and update all sales related KPI’s

ONIFY are looking for an individual who is passionate about sales and can work hard and think positive in a fast-paced sales environment. A strategic thinker, with the ability to work effectively under pressure and be able to prioritise and meet sales targets and KPI's.

We are a remote business, which means all our employees currently work from a location that suits them. If you've never worked remotely before, don’t worry, you’ll soon grow to love it. We have daily video catch ups, weekly meetings and regular chat on our communication networks, so you won’t ever feel on your own for the day.

This position is full time, however, your hours can be flexible to fit around your personal circumstances and needs of the business. Access to a computer, fast internet and a quiet place to work from are essential. There will be a solid basic salary as well as tiered commision levels to really help incentivise your sales ability.

If this sounds perfect for you, please apply with a covering letter explaining why you would be perfect for the role along with your current CV. We will not be reviewing applications that don’t have a covering letter attached, so please include one if you are seriously interested in becoming part of our team.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £18,000.00 to £25,000.00 /year

Required experience:

  • telesales: 1 year

Kindly Care helps families find, hire, and manage private caregivers so that their elderly loved ones can age in their homes rather having to move into assisted living facilities. We take pride in the fact that we’re working on one of the most pressing problems in our society: ensuring that our seniors are taken care of despite seemingly endless challenges caused by fiscal and labor shortages.

We’re a geographically distributed company, with 4 team members working out of our office in San Francisco and about 40 others working from all over the US, Canada, Mexico and a number of other countries. items.content:
Head of Partnerships

Posted Jan 6

TaxJar
Headquarters: Boston, MA
www.taxjar.com/jobs

TaxJar has an immediate opening for an enthusiastic, experienced, and driven Head of Partnerships to help small and medium sized eCommerce businesses save time and money on sales tax compliance.

This is a full-time remote position, available to folks located in the continental US only.

About TaxJar

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 10,000 businesses. We were founded to help eCommerce owners spend less time on sales tax and more time growing the businesses they love. We’re passionate about creating simple solutions and leveraging technology to solve complicated sales tax issues. We're not just about sales tax though, we're a technology-driven company focused on providing a great experience for both merchants and developers.

We offer TaxJar Reports , a simple web-based reporting tool that organizes sales tax data into return-ready reports by state; AutoFile, a service that automatically files sales tax returns; and SmartCalcs API, a modern, accurate, sales tax API for developers to outsource sales tax rates and calculations. For developers, we have created an helpful API demo environment and also are fanatics about creating and maintaining great API documentation.

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

About TaxJar’s Growth Team:

The mission of TaxJar’s growth team consists of sales, marketing, content, and partnerships, and our mission in is clear: get more eCommerce businesses in the US to experience using TaxJar for managing their sales tax reporting, filing and calculations, and to help show those businesses the tremendous value in cost and time-savings in choosing to fully automate their sales tax needs.

The team’s goal is to maximize the number of qualified customers that begin our free trial and ensure the highest percentage of those folks end up as a customers on the other side. Our team is small, but we have a huge impact on the business. We work very closely with  the customer success and product development teams in order to deliver on these goals.

We are looking to expand the team with a talented and experienced Head of Partnership that fully understands how to own and grow the relationships with our partners.

Areas of focus for this role will be

1. Working with our existing eCommerce and channel partners to increase TaxJar’s exposure in their ecosystems, and develop plans to create mutual success. These partnerships include eCommerce carts, marketplaces, and key influencers of these channels.

2. Establish and grow a program to work with the eCommerce channel partners, including systems integrators and digital agencies who build, deploy and maintain eCommerce sites for merchants, and develop a process to measure success of the channel.

3. Own the strategy for future partnerships and TaxJar integrations, and execute on a partner roadmap. This will also include building our in-house and third party integrations strategy, developing our affiliate program, and building plans to work with CPAs and tax professionals.

4. Build a partnerships team. This role will begin as a very hands-on execution role with no direct reports, but expect that a successful team member will develop the processes including establishment of KPIs and dashboards, reporting, and ultimately build out a partnerships team based on his or her recommended growth plan, and primarily funded through revenue growth generated through partnerships.

10 things About You…

  1. You have a track record of building strong relationships. You’ve been able to build a large partner & channel marketing base in previous roles of customers and partners that know and trust you. You’ve demonstrated results delivering on partner KPIs in the past.
  2. You can see the full-picture. You’re thoughtful and organized. Before beginning a project, you take the time to understand both “why we’re doing this” and “why it makes sense to do this now”.
  3. You’re a pro at communicating. When working with the team and externally with customers, you’re a pro at both communicating clearly and listening to feedback. You have excellent visual and verbal communication skills. You’re a great writer who can effectively and creatively communicate TaxJar’s value to businesses across a variety of formats and platforms.
  4. You’re a self-starter with an entrepreneurial mindset, able to build and execute a plan with imperfect data. You’re resourceful and scrappy and able to leverage content and tools to get programs started quickly. You have an understanding of complete go-to-market planning and execution.
  5. You have a strong work ethic with the ability to prioritize, you meet deadlines and requirements of internal and external customers by responding promptly and thoroughly with all types of requests.
  6. You’re an excellent project manager who can be counted on to deliver quality results for multiple projects to completion on a deadline.
  7. You’re a team player, and a team builder. You step in to help when others need you and your job is to make “all boats rise” on our team. You’re also fully open to giving and receiving thoughtful, constructive straightforward feedback as you learn and grow. You have experience in building out a high performing team.
  8. You understand the role of education in the sales process. You’ve had experience designing and implementing programs and scaleable trainings to help educate channel partners on your product’s value and purpose.
  9. You’ve closely partnered with sales or have worked in a sales environment in previous roles. You’re able to provide consultative sales support and training/demonstrations for partners and customers.
  10. You’ve managed and grown a partner program from the ground up and have shown the ability to initiate processes, effectively manage partners, build materials and structure a program build strong relationships and drive additional leads.

If that sounds like you, here’s what we need you to help with:

  • Develop and maintain multi-level relationships with key partner brands, customers, and influencers. Collaborate with partners to identify and creative high-value co-marketing opportunities.

  • Build a playbook to launch and grow the channel marketing program, and then execute on it.

  • Take ownership of the TaxJar affiliate program. Create opportunities and incentives for new partners to join our channel and affiliate programs.

  • Build a plan to expand TaxJar’s data integration partners, including additional eCommerce and ERP integrations, and considering internally build and third party integrations

  • Develop a plan for building a channel of CPAs and Tax Professionals, and work closely with product development to build the features they need in TaxJar.

  • Work closely with marketing to define and craft messaging, positioning, and core marketing collateral for programs.

  • Proactively drive all internal and partner communications for channel programs, including sharing of best practices and case studies to drive further buy-in and adoption of TaxJar across channels.

  • Manage demand generation programs like webinars, blogs, white papers, etc. for partners and work closely with growth team to optimize effectiveness of campaigns.

  • Follow channel programs through to completion by working closely with sales to qualify leads. and completing post-program ROI analysis. Always be willing to dive into our data and help the team understand how we’re doing and where we can improve.

  • Willingness to travel and attend in-person trade shows and live events with customers and communicate with partners through various channels including social media, slack, etc

Preferred Qualifications

  • 5+ years with partnerships experience in the tech space, preferably in marketing SaaS technologies to eCommerce audiences
  • 2+ years of leading a team or managing people

  • Strong, existing relationships in eCommerce is a big plus

    • You are assertive, fair, and capable of directing others and implementing projects with little to no supervision.

    • You have a positive leadership style, hold yourself accountable for your actions, encourage the team to learn from mistakes, and recognize your team for their efforts.

    • 5+ years in managing Corporate Events or Tech events
    • Executive level communication, interpersonal and delegation skills.

Royal DSM is a global science-based company active in health, nutrition and materials. Would you enjoy a position in account management that implements the account strategy for the business? Interested in working for an industry leader that values safety, sustainability, and employee development? If you’re a sales professional with a proven record of success in managing accounts, developing new business and building long-term customer relationships, this could be the perfect match for you!

DSM Resins & Functional Materials is a global supplier of innovative high-quality resins solutions for paints and coatings, fiber optic coatings and 3D printing.

In functional materials, DSM is the global leader in fiber-optic coatings with its portfolio of DeSolite® Supercoatings and in additive manufacturing – 3D printing – DSM offers highly efficient and effective SOMOS® prototyping technologies and supports the industry in accelerating the pace at which new products are designed and brought to market.

New Business Development Manager Packaging & Printing is the primary contact between the customer and the company, bring forth the required customer needs and serves as a conduit to the organization for market information such as trends, and competitive activity and general market intelligence of the segments serviced.

  • Build cross discipline and multi-layer contacts within the account for maximum success in account management
  • Identify long term business opportunities with the account(s) and include these in the account strategy and plan; define these opportunities in the Regional Sales opportunity list (SOL); manage the SOL and related actions to bring the opportunities to fruition
  • Be responsible for collecting market information and communicating current and emerging needs for the key account
  • Define and Implement development projects in concert with Industry Manager with focus on key products and innovation

  • Minimum 5 years of Specialty Chemical Sales experience required

  • Sales experience with UV curable polymers are a plus

  • Key Account management of large multinational accounts a plus

  • Sales within Graphic Arts industry experience preferred.

  • Build cross discipline and multi-layer contacts within the account for maximum success in account management
  • Identify long term business opportunities with the account(s) and include these in the account strategy and plan; define these opportunities in the Regional Sales opportunity list (SOL); manage the SOL and related actions to bring the opportunities to fruition
  • Be responsible for collecting market information and communicating current and emerging needs for the key account
  • Define and Implement development projects in concert with Industry Manager with focus on key products and innovation
  • Execute negotiations on pricing, delivery, etc. within the boundaries set by the business; lead contract and price negotiations with the respective account(s) and ensure the conclusion of sales contracts and price levels within the agreed price volume targets
  • Coordinate technical services and/or after sales service activities for the account
  • Collect customer and/or market information and communicate current and emerging needs for the accounts and sales forecasting as input for the Demand Plan


What we want to see in you:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field required; degree in Chemistry preferred. Bachelor’s degree in Business will be considered, if accompanied by proven training and knowledge of chemical products and the industry
  • Minimum 5 years of Specialty Chemical Sales experience required
  • Proven success in sales in the field necessary
  • Sales experience with Waterborne Acrylic and/or urethane polymer specific preferred
  • Sales experience with UV curable polymers are a plus
  • Experience calling on large multinational accounts required
  • Key Account management of large multinational accounts a plus
  • Demonstrate effective communication skills with coworkers, management and customers
  • Experience with key account planning/coordination required; key account planning/coordination across international regions a plus
  • Sales within Graphic Arts industry experience preferred.
  • Coating resins and/or Adhesive Sales experience a plus
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as good interpersonal skills in working with colleagues across various company disciplines
  • Ability to travel multiple days/week across broad geography on routine basis. (50%+ travel dependent upon place of residence)
